TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lived in GPE . He died on DATE . He is represented before the ORG by ORG and PERSON , respectively his daughter and her husband . They both live in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE , the applicant , a war veteran , lodged with ORG an action against ORG of Bucharest ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) and ORG CARDINALrd district of GPE seeking the allocation of FAC ha of land . The action was brought pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL on war veterans .

By a judgment of DATE ORG ordered ORG to assess the availability of plots of land located within the city area and to allocate one to the applicant pursuant to LAW no.CARDINAL/CARDINAL . The appeal lodged by ORG was rejected on DATE by a final decision of ORG .

In DATE the representatives of the applicant lodged in his name with ORG an action against ORG and the mayor of GPE , seeking damages on account of the delay in enforcing the judgment . On DATE ORG imposed on the mayor a fine of ROL CARDINAL per day of delay from DATE until the enforcement of the judgment . This judgment was upheld by ORG in a final decision of DATE .
On DATE , the representatives of the applicant informed the ORG , in his name , that the judgment of DATE had still not been enforced .

On DATE , the applicant appointed as his representatives PERSON and PERSON , his daughter and her husband . The applicant granted them the power to file applications with the NORP courts and to pursue the enforcement of any court decisions adopted as a consequence of any such actions .
Thereafter , the applicant was represented before the national courts by his daughter and her husband .
According to the death certificate submitted by the ORG and uncontested by ORG and PERSON , the applicant died on DATE .

The application lodged with the ORG on DATE , on behalf of the applicant , was signed on his behalf by his daughter , PERSON PERSON . The representatives did not inform the Registry at any time in the course of the proceedings before ORG death of the applicant .

By letter of DATE , following a request by ORG , PERSON submitted the power of attorney designating her and her husband as the applicant ’s representatives in the LAW proceedings . This document was signed by ORG and PERSON Constantin on behalf of the applicant .

They reminded the ORG , among other things , that the letter of authority of CARDINAL DATE , which was valid according to NORP legislation , remained valid until the death of the representatives . As a consequence , they considered the ORG ’s request redundant .
The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows in their part concerning the power of a person to represent the interests of another person .
“ The power of representation is extinguished when : ( ... )
CARDINAL . the representative or the principal dies ... ”
The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows in their parts concerning the power to represent another person in legal proceedings :
“ The authority to act in legal proceedings does not cease to exist upon the death of the principal ... It continues to be valid until the heirs withdraw it ... ”
